data.enText: to go around an area or a building at regular times to check that it is safe and that there is no trouble

data.chText: 军队日夜在边境地区巡逻。
data.enText: Troops patrolled the border day and night.

data.chText: 到处都能见到保安人员在巡逻。
data.enText: Guards can be seen patrolling everywhere.
to drive or walk around a particular area, especially in a threatening way

data.chText: 夜里成帮结伙的年轻人在街上闲逛。
data.enText: Gangs of youths patrol the streets at night.
the act of going to different parts of a building, an area, etc. to make sure that there is no trouble or crime

data.chText: 夜间保安人员定时巡逻。
data.enText: Security guards make regular patrols at night.
a group of soldiers, vehicles, etc. that patrol an area
a group of about six Boy Scouts or Girl Guides/Scouts that forms part of a larger group

tr: the activity of going around or through an area at regular intervals for security purposes
a detachment used for security or reconnaissance
a group that goes through a region at regular intervals for the purpose of security
maintain the security of by carrying out a patrol

value.def: When soldiers, police, or guards patrol an area or building, they move around it in order to make sure that there is no trouble there.

example.ex: Prison officers continued to patrol the grounds within the jail.
He failed to return from a patrol.
example.tran: 他去巡逻，然后没再回来。

value.def: Soldiers, police, or guards who are on patrol are patrolling an area.

example.ex: The army is now on patrol in Srinagar and a curfew has been imposed...
example.tran: 军队目前在斯利那加巡逻，且已实行了宵禁。

example.ex: Security forces remained on patrol until late into the night.
example.tran: 保安部队继续巡逻至深夜。

value.def: A patrol is a group of soldiers or vehicles that are patrolling an area.

example.ex: Guerrillas attacked a patrol with hand grenades.
example.tran: 游击队用手榴弹袭击了巡逻队。

example.ex: ...a border patrol operating near the Burmese frontier.
example.tran: 在缅甸边界巡逻的边境巡逻队
